review:
Its a good game.

Pros: 
Free to do what you want
lots of stuff to mess around with.
Good physics
Great visuals (dependent of PC Specs)

Cons: 
multiplayer is a bit iffy and is hard to get working on lower spec devices.


Would recommend this, great game but if your looking for an open do what you want car game with multiplayer look somewhere else if you have a lower end device.

review: I really like the game. It's cool that you can build your own car, and race on so many different tracks. I also like that you can publish your own car and download other published cars. There are a few negatives tho... I can't play with mt friends even though there is a multiplayer option, but I hope that gets fixed in an update. Story mode is also kind of boring, so I would think that there would be events or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129962238', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4208, 'last_played': 1699050697}
review: Great vehicle sandbox, I wish there were more like this with this level of detail and intuitive building interface. The only problem I have with it is its simplicity and lack of features, but I can't really expect more from what seems to be an individual developer. What they have managed is nothing short of incredible. If there was a tool as good as the builder in this for designing cars for BeamNG, I'd have already released a couple mods by now and I bet the BeamNG devs would have an easier time releasing new vehicles. I don't know where Roman Konyukhov came from, but the vehicle sandbox world needs more of him.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372931496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9980, 'last_played': 1695525745}
review: jogo ótimo, físicas realistas, um jogo em que mostra o que a criatividade pode fazer ao contruir um carro, o jogo possui uma gameplay que se baseia em você criar um carro totalmente do zero, porém com uma dificuldade extra em relação a criação, já que a fisica do jogo está presente em toda a estrutura do carro, desde o chassi até a tração. O que me fez viciar neste incrível jogo é o fato de que a criação de veículos possui uma gameplay parecida com o Poly Bridge, que faz com que o jogador necessite de habilidades um pouco avançadas ao criar um carro que fique estável e que funcione adequadamente sem se desmontar todo

author: {'steamid': '76561198025109668', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 74210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74210, 'last_played': 1680609938}
review:
I put hundreds of fun hours into this, until two things happened:

* the dev did not like my minimal cars that used lots of down-force with low drag, so he re-coded the game to make that impossible
* after years the game stopped responding to my left thumb-stick, which works perfectly fine in any other game, so it is unplayable now

So I deleted all my tracks and cars, no sense contributing to a game where the dev does not like my ideas and can't keep it working with vanilla controllers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992557240', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 2481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2404, 'last_played': 1678491916}
review:
Some would not even call this a game, but rather a physics sand box toy that lets you build and drive vehicles. There is very little gameplay in terms of predetermined levels and stuff, so be warned in case you were hoping for a complete experience out of the box.

Once you overcome the learning barriers and start to make functional vehicles, there is a lot of fun to be had just free roaming different maps or having races against ghosts of other players on predetermined tracks or drag strips. Recently built my first flying thing, which again has a completely different set of parameters to consider compared to cars.

All in all, very fun for what it is, but definitely requires a time commitment and willingness to trial-and-error your way to whatever you want to achieve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099074028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1674692093}
review:
I kept playing this game on and off to see what changed.
Unfortunately, as deep as this game is, it still is really rough around the edges.
The last update is from 2019, so it'll probably stay that way.

For a game about building cars, there are a lot of nonsensical choices when it comes to building, it's not uncommon to see cars that have an engine hovering somewhere without anything connected to it powering the cars.

As for the gameplay, the cars handle really badly and the deformation is really exaggerated
The aerodynamic simulation is REALLY GOOD, I have seen literal Magnus Effect planes and all sorts of aircraft made here.
But for cars, this game is just not good.
There's some fun to be had here, but I can't recommend this at all.

review:
文字通り車作りのゲームです。それに関しては他のレビューと言うことも変わらないので略
ワークショップは思いのほか活発に更新されているので定期的に見ると暇つぶしになります。
ちなみにBlenderやMetasequoiaなどなどからモデルを引っ張ることができるのでモデリングができる方はさらに車作りが捗るモノとなっております。
オンライン部屋が立ち上がる時間帯が大体午前２～１１時頃なので行きづらいですが、それ以外は不満もないので創造力が旺盛な方には非常にオススメです。

author: {'steamid': '76561199122555812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1682242411}
review: This is probably one of the best games I have ever played, I love the realism that the game has to offer and I am surprised that the game isn't more popular. One of the best games I have ever played, I hope that they keep on working on this game and they should be proud of what they have created. A few recommendations I would make is that maybe they could add hydraulics as well as the rods so that you can make things move around, just like in dream car racing EVO and have also add a rotator that you must link up to the engine but could have a separate key bind that can be chosen by the player to rotate a structure, just like in dream car racing EVO. I am making these recommendations because they were so fun to play around with in dream car racing EVO, so it would be a great addition to this game. Whether or not my suggestions are added to the game, this is still a great game and definitely my favourite game out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199033111541', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 59714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16226, 'last_played': 1708074691}
review:
I bought the game just because I was bored, one day I was so bored I downloaded it and started playing right away. I only lasted 15 minutes. Now I have 300 hours worth of fun, creating and developing my own projects such as cars, planes, propeller planes, and I even tried to build a helicopter! Nonetheless there are some things I think the Devs should worry about. Multiplayer. The game is perfect in terms of physics and realism, but it lacks the multiplayer function. I would suggest the Devs implement a "Create Server" button on multiplayer mode, so that multiplayer will at least be a thing. 

I 100% percent recommend this game, I've had a lot of fun and enjoyment playing it. If you are someone who is interested by the world of engineering and mechanics, you should buy this game right away!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998433532', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1611621247}
review:
Interesting game, has freedom to build, however it is quite difficult (not that is a bad thing, but rather more of a QOL thing), it hasnt received any updates since 2019, as of the moment im writing this. Has quite a few features missing as well. If you are looking for a game just to spend your time doing something, this might work for you, however if you are looking for something more than just that, better look elsewhere.

Its NOT a bad game, just needs to be worked on(a lot).

author: {'steamid': '76561198332552696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 87753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 140, 'playtime_at_review': 35008, 'last_played': 1711597074}
review:
I've played plenty of machine builders before and I must say, although Dreamcar 3d isn't perfect, no other builder stands a chance in comparison because this is ABSOLUTELY the best builder out there, now let me tell you why.

First thing, freedom. Any vehicle in reality can be recreated, straight down to the suspension and frame. Although it may seem low poly at first, but there are plenty of techniques and design tricks to make some of the most accurate to real life vehicles out there, and with the help of blender, you are able to make rides 1-to-1. The only visual limits are your own imagination, and those set by your computer. (however, if you're more of a visual designer and couldn't care less about physics, I'd recommend Main Assembly.)

Second, physics. The soft body physics in this game are criminally underrated. You are able to create some of the most realistic preforming and crashing vehicles that anything else on steam has to offer! Hell, you're even able to recreate cars from Beamng.Drive! Seriously! This fact only gets more amplified, as you're able to import flexibody objects from blender, and basically create the J-beam structure in DreamCar! (or U-beam I guess in this case.) Although it does take knowledge to do so, the fact that it is possible should make this game way more popular than what it is right now.

And third, it's educational value. Since soft-body is as close to real life as it gets, you learn a lot of things that are applicable to real life in this game, whether it be about design philosophy, Suspension articulation and tuning, or aerodynamics, you will learn so much just by sticking with this game and keeping an interest! This game is the most bang for your buck you can get out of a builder on steam, and it is only ten bucks!

Although I am a firm believer that this game is the best builder out there, it does need a few things, and if it did have these, it would make all other builders irrelevant, and possibly bring the popularity back to this game. If I could recommend anything, I would add:
1- Computer and logistic blocks, the possibilities would be endless. (like if x was broken, it would disable engine, or at x speed, a rod would raise. Although it wouldn't be entirely physics based anymore, it would make this game a unbeatable juggernaut.)
2- The ability to spawn multiple cars. It feels quite barren at times, also this would showcase the soft body physics a bit better.
3- Interact-able AI. The race mode is a little bland, but I can understand the limitations. Soft body physics are quite punishing to run on lower grade computers, but I feel we're at the point where there are lots out there that can run it.
4- Possibly a more intuitive tutorial. Lots of complaints that come from this game are the fact that people don't entirely understand how to operate the builder. Although the tutorials aren't bad by any means, I do think that a more interactive one may make people stop whining about it in the reviews.
5- CUSTOM. ENGINE. SOUNDS. pls. I don't think I need to explain this one.
6- Further customization towards engines. Although there is a lot of variety in engines, I feel as having for freedom towards engine customization would add a lot more depth and decrease linearity. Also, you can't tune automatic transmissions.
7- Servos. Although jet propulsion spinners are there, I do feel that servos are needed in this game. For instance, cool uses would be propellers, radiator fans, custom wheels, walker builds, etc.
8- Gears and chains. Keep normal transmission frames, but make an optional way to transverse power. Would add optional realism with infinite possibilities.
9- Panels with optional self collision. It would make things more realistic.
10- Further optimizations. Some things drop frames for no reason.

Although I don't think any of these will ever come in the future, since the dev kinda just left it for dead, I still have hope and passion for this game, as I played 600 hours on it and I am still learning new things. Regardless of this game's popularity, I love this game, although I wish that it was given the support that this game deserved. This game is a gold mine of potential, and it was given up on too soon.

In conclusion, I absolutely recommend it to anyone who loves building cars or anyone with enough patience to learn it's builder.

review:
If you know what you're doing this can be a fun little game, though it's feeling pretty much abandoned by the developer now (and has seemed this way for a few years).
There's also now quite a lot of other games that do similar things, that are still actively being updated and do so many of the features in a much more user friendly way.

If you're into saving a some money, or perhaps like the style of some of the workshop content, then it's worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561199022959689', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4454, 'last_played': 1710903594}
review:
[h1] Melhor Construtor de carros que já joguei [/h1]

Dream car Builder é um jogo realmente bem difícil no inicio, passei horas assistindo vídeos para aprender a fazer um carro que ande e vire para os lados, muitos falam que não tem multiplayer em tempo real, mas na verdade tem sim, porem pra abrir um servidor é extremamente difícil, esse é o único ponto ruim em minha opinião, consegui jogar poucas vezes com meus amigos em tempo real, jogo esse jogo desde sua versão flash, o "Dream car Racing" eu adorava também, podem comprar que vale a pena

author: {'steamid': '76561198033125689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1693542211}
review:
The fact that joints aren't static by default and everything flops around without using an ugly 'angle lock' is just baffling to me. This game treats some things like physics very realistically yet disregards realism with it's design system by making every joint out of jello; ever see a tube frame flail about before irl? No? Didn't think so.

Visually it's deficient and relies on custom 3D models to make anything worthwhile that isn't a panel clad dune buggy.

I really wouldn't recommend this game. It plays far worse than it looks

author: {'steamid': '76561198335757677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 22076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21734, 'last_played': 1693318081}
review:
This is probably one of the better engineering-type games on steam, in my experience. Unlike the flash games that inspired it, this game is involved. Working in the 3D space adds so much to the concept Dream Car Builder had - build cars to defeat specific challenges. This ratchets it up a lot. You have to consider a lot - camber, travel, damage, torque, traction, caster, the way your wheels move as the suspension travels, the weight distribution - I could go on. While it is simplified to some extent from the real deal, which is obvious, the careful consideration called for if you want to tackle races and win is immersive and challenging. 

Pros:

- Thorough, involved design process
- Broad creative potential
- Easy to learn but challenging to master
- Sturdy physics engine with realistic handling, deformation, and aerodynamics
- Straightforward UI
- A sandbox mode, where the constraints of money are no longer an issue
- Fun for those who like the idea of building any kind of vehicle you want
- Smooth and stable with few major issues, fewer still that would affect the normal player
- Lightweight and runs well on low end machines
- Straightforward controls (Which you can change from car to car!)

Cons:
- Challenging to master
- Steep learning curve with little to no tutorial
- Involved
- Kind of ugly UI that can be tricky to navigate
- Has not been updated for some time and could use new content
- Multiplayer is dead from the start because the way it works is convoluted

author: {'steamid': '76561198991228080', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3390, 'last_played': 1684257327}
review:
钢管汽车模拟器wwwwwwwwwwwww
这游戏还可以利用空气动力造飞机。
优点：可以入门汽车悬挂结构。
缺点：设计过于简单，角度锁也只能锁钢管之间的角度，没办法锁钢管的轴，很多结构都没办法实现或者很难实现，这会导致一部分种类的悬挂实现起来与现实中稍有不同。
总体来说是个非常有趣的游戏，设计两小时，比赛五分钟。

author: {'steamid': '76561198306552393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1626916803}
review: This is an interesting case, I like this game but in some respects it's hard to recommend. For example I adore the sheer freedom this game gives you to create whatever you want. But on the other hand the editor definitely takes some getting used to. If you don't know what you're doing you'll end up making some cars that just disintegrate, and others as rigid as concrete. This, however, may just be me being stupid. All I know is I, personally, had a lot of trouble getting used to the editor, and making my own cars. But if you're willing to put in the time and figure out how to make your own cars, the rewards are definitely worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561199026935529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 67095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1799, 'playtime_at_review': 21997, 'last_played': 1712377077}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110967997', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2020, 'last_played': 1671828786}
review:
10/10, Years of learning how car suspension works and finally a game where I could apply this near useless knowledge. This allowed me to get 7th fastest in the world on one of the tracks after only a day of playing. 

I've wanted for so long a game where I could apply this knowledge, games like Scrap Mechanic and Beamng.Drive never scratched this itch all the way, but this game does, It was so satisfying to build a car and have it behave realistically as I expected.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106484731', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1650606105}
review:
This is not a game about building your dream car. This is about being the car builder of your dreams.

In the past two days I've played about 16 hours of this game. It's amazing how much time you can spend engineering suspension systems and then crashing the same vehicle in 50 different ways.

I think the sandbox mode is the only true way to experience this game. You can spend 30 minutes or so working on a super fancy suspension system, then watch it crunch in front of your eyes because you forgot to add a support beam. That just makes it all the more satisfying when you finally get it working.

You get to watch your intricate mechanisms working in a realistic way (other than the fact that frames have no collisions, only the points). You get to drive fast and crash in slow motion.

Want to make a crab car? A porta-potty that drives? Or a replica of a real car, complete with the same suspension setup? You can do that in this game.

That said, there is no logic or programming, it's purely physics-based, which means this game does not scratch ALL my itches... but it sure does scratch a lot of them!

Other reviews have compared the user experience of the editor to that of working in CAD. I can see the similarity, yeah. It's just a lot more intuitive and fun than CAD is. There are no sketches, extrusions, tolerances etc. just you and your vertex-based creation. Have fun!

review: One of the most underrated building games I've ever seen. The building style is definitely different, but pretty easy to learn. It feels like a mix of everything great from Simple Planes and BeamNG Drive put into one game, not to mention it's cheaper than either without sales. This game works the best for build-and-fly-*ehem* build-and-drive kinda people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064287020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3537, 'last_played': 1710563310}
review:
If you are a car/suspension nerd, this game is for you. For pretty much anyone else, ehhhh. It does take some design  knowledge to have fun with it.

It does take a little getting used to just because of the way the game works but it doesnt take long to figure out. Unless you "fix angles", every frame piece is free to move like a spherical joint, so that means you have to triangulate everything that you dont want to move. I would like it if the default joint was like it was welded, then you chose if you want it to be a ball joint, bushing, etc. Theres other aspects of the game that are a little weird as well. Everything has vague absolute values. Like say, your cars shocks have a spring rate of 2500. 2500 what tho? Same goes for damping. Your adjustment range is on a slider from -1 to 1. It would be a little more intuitive if things were assigned values used in the real wold. But I guess thats more an issue of it being made in unity.
It isnt the prettiest game, but again, unity. I see it more as an interactive design tool than a game anyway.
You can build pretty much any suspension you can think of in this game, it just takes some creativity.
As far as I can tell this game is made by one dude, so mad props to you. You've made a rad piece of software.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367097079', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1660348841}
review:
В игре ты сам себе мастер, из готового только водительское место и колёса, остальное делаешь сам, включаешь фантазию и делаешь всё,что только придёт в голову. 
Так же есть уже готовые рамы и модели в целом, их можно скачать и дорабатывать самостоятельно.

Имеется что-то на подобии сюжетной игры, где нужно прокачивать детали и дорабатывать машину , чтобы выиграть гонки.

Как по мне, игра отличная

author: {'steamid': '76561198999721968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 212302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 123, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1711838045}
review: OK, so now that I have played this game for long enough, I'll give some proper feedback. The game is beyond excellent, basically unlimited possibilities for creations. Engineer all sorts of mechanisms, from helicopter's swashplates, to complex heave suspension. The game always keeps you coming, finding ways to improve on your past creations, and can even encourage learning about mechanical engineering and it's principles. The community behind the game are beyond awesome, and isn't nearly as limiting as most voxel based games like stormworks. This game allows the user to import their own models, giving more freedom to the designer of any kind! I truly recomend this game, and like I said when I only had 24 hours in, it's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158479196', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 17475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7597, 'last_played': 1710792596}
review:
The building can be pretty daunting, but it's part of the reason I enjoy it. Too many vehicle sandbox games dumb down the level of intricacy that you can build easily and well at. This one doesn't. It's almost closer to a CAD program than a video game. I play by thinking of a design or car I want to replicate, design a chassis for it that drives nice (usually the hardest part) then decorate it. It's an amazing tool to really construct any of the crazy car ideas you have. It's really great tool for it.

I felt like i had to return to this review after 3 years to give this game praise for a very special reason. I cracked open one of my technical manuals and read through the chapters on suspension design, and it made my car designs handle better. I can't say that about any other game. Learning a real life skill made me better at a video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027065997', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1598249029}
review:
Best game I've ever refunded.

While the game didn't scratch my weirdly-particular itch for a customization-heavy arcade racer, it would be remiss of me to deny that this game may very well be THE most in-depth car-building-and-testing simulator on the market.

Anyone with even a passing interest in designing and testing out unorthodox vehicle designs really ought to check this game out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000667855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 133430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18851, 'last_played': 1707448150}
review: While it is challenging to learn, this is because it is a complex game with potentially hundreds or thousands of hours worth of playing potential. Ever since I got this game, I have spent over 300 hours building projects including panel cars and trucks (built only with in-game parts), .Obj vehicles (basically the body and other details built in blender then imported, and built the chassis, suspension, etc. in-game) and recently into making custom maps, which can be made up to about 20kmx20km. My favorite part about this game is the offroading, and that is where I have focused most of my attention. I do not see myself stopping any time soon. Highly recommended, especially since it is cheap to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297926070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1600618225}
review: it doesn't run
developer_response:
The steam client should download and install windows visual c++ redistibutables 2013 and 2017 with the game.
But, some times it glitches and doesn't download it.

Do the following:
1. Remove these redistibutables from your computer manually.
2. Reinstall the game.
3. Reinstall visual c++ redistibutables 2013 and 2017 manually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032906214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1595960542}
review: A ideia de montar o veículo é legal, tem muitas opções para fazer, aeronaves, helicópteros, carros, se duvidar até motos. Os problemas do jogo são simples, a ideia era trazer algo parecido com BeamNG Drive, porém, os veículos são indestrutíveis, enquanto os veículos nem batendo a 200 km/h destrói, ele quica na parede e cai no chão como se nada tivesse acontecido, em compensação, as rodas estragam por qualquer coisa. Recomendo esse jogo se a sua ideia é apenas montar os veículos, em questão de destrutibilidade e gameplay, esse jogo é bem fraco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195535787', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1594248384}
review: So I just bought this game for $6.99 and my buddy and I were really excited to play it, but when we went to launch the multiplayer section we only realized that the game supports LAN and not p2p through the steam api, meaning you cant join a friends game through steam. This game says its a multiplayer game, but it's a local multiplayer game. I will refund until this is fixed. Other than that Its a great game I used to watch Scrap man on YouTube play it all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212180467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1660700751}
review:
this game is very fun however, the multiplayer experience however is not. In the tags this game is listed as being Online pvp, do not be mistaken. there is not multiplayer framework for this game. if you want to play with your friends be prepared to do the work to MAKE your game multiplayer, because it is not multiplayer as purchased. 

Besides that this is an incredible game for those who enjoy designing their own suspension, steering, and frame.  But because of the problems with multiplayer, and how deceitful the trailers of this game are. As well as the lack of mention relating to the multiplayer, I cannot recommend anyone buy this game. 4.5/10
developer_response:
If you argue this way, then Сounter Strike, for example, is also not a multiplayer game. Because in order to play there, any of the players must first start the game server.

How to set up a Dream Car Builder Dedicated Server: https://steamcommunity.com/app/488550/discussions/0/1742231705665537951/

author: {'steamid': '76561198093443595', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1590380228}
review: This game is not quite as fun as I was hoping, the building is needlessly complicated and difficult to understand, even after doing it right with the not very helpful tutorial, I still couldn't quite get a car to work. I just could never have fun building anything in this when it's so hard to do the most basic vehicle you can.
developer_response:
This game is not for everyone, that's why the description of the game contains this text:

"Attention:
It is not a game where you connect two blocks and get a working part. The game uses a real soft-body physics, where beams can stretch or compress.
Please do not buy this game if you are afraid of complex designs or documentation to read."

You left a negative review, because the game is not as simple as you want.
Please, read about the game before you buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380946467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3988, 'last_played': 1697388142}

author: {'steamid': '76561198191740939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2405, 'last_played': 1685004186}
review:
I like the concept of this game, I really do. But this game can get extremely frustrating, and confusing the less you know. Steering especially is very annoying and hard to build. If your looking for a simple build and play experience, I wouldn't buy this. Buy something like Scrap Mechanic, or Besiege. But if you really want an experience with a complex building game, I would buy this.

Edit: Watching tutorials helps a lot, Also the mod yelled at me and I felt bad so I changed it
developer_response:
I added this text in the game's desctiption:
"Attention:
It is not a game where you connect two blocks and get a working part. The game uses a real soft-body physics, where beams can stretch or compress.
Please do not buy this game if you are afraid of complex designs or documentation to read."

I posted this in the game's disscusions:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/488550/discussions/0/1629664606989174720/

You left this negative review. Please read about the game before you buy it!

review: I'm not saying that all people won't like this game. But the building physics are hard to control. Some people who want to appreciate the crashing physics and just the all around driving, have at it. But for people who love to build their own stuff, be warned, this game is very hard to build in.
developer_response:
Yes, this game is not for everyone:

The game's description:
"Attention:
It is not a game where you connect two blocks and get a working part. The game uses a real soft-body physics, where beams can stretch or compress.
Please do not buy this game if you are afraid of complex designs or documentation to read."

review:
Before you purchase this game, keep in mind that building in this game is tedious and not easy. You need to have an background in physics and engineering in order to build the vehicles in the game. If you lack experience or patience with building vehicles, do not waste your ten dollars. 

The game has a sand block mode, as well as multiplayer (beta) and single player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277825782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1585572432}
review:
Игра норм конечно, жаль только, что она не располагает к реальному проектированию. Просто есть 2 пути - либо ты строишь подвеску по фэншую и физике, чтобы не было перекрытий рам, амортизаторов и трансмиссии, учитываешь повороты колес, чтобы они не соприкасались с рамами подвески. В итоге получаешь весьма тяжелую и непрочную конструкцию, удовлетворившую твой инженерный порыв хотя бы тем, что она просто работает как задумывалось. Потом пробуешь гонять на ней в соревнованиях, довольствуясь последними местами. Затем плюешь на свои инженерные амбиции и пересобираешь ее на более легкую версию с максимально большими плечами, перекрывающими друг друга рамами и трансмиссией, пущенной по кратчайшей прямой от движка на колеса, амортизаторами где попало, и рычагами, торчащими сквозь колеса.
Короче, грустно, что любые поделки с дизайном  под реализацию в металле ВСЕГДА будут уступать болидам, заточенным под кривую физику этой игры. Так же рамники на мостах имеют огромное игровое преимущество по той причине, что оси раздатки и дифференциалы трансмиссии весят как самая легкая рама. А из-за некорректного подсчета веса участков рам, длинноходная независимая подвеска всегда будет выходить сильно перегруженной из-за большого количества усиливающих перемычек, добавляющих жесткости, без которых не обойтись.
developer_response:
Попробуйте включить 2000 Гц физику (если это еще не было сделано), там максимальная жесткость конструкций повышена в 4 раза по сравнению с 1000 Гц физикой.

А вообще отношение жесткости к массе ограничено частотой физики, то есть быстротой вибраций, которую может воспроизводить компьютер. Раньше такое было возможно только на супер-компьютерах.

Как я понял, отрицательный отзыв поставлен, за то, что физика имеет такое ограничение на обычном компьютере, хотя в реальном мире у физики нет таких ограничений.

В реальном мире одновременно действуют и меняются беконечное число сил в разных точках, даже внутри одной рамы. Даже самый крутой супер-компьютер не сможет идеально воссоздать такое.

Такие вещи приблизительно делаются на ПО по тестированию конструкций, но там расчеты далеко не в реалтайме идут и без графики.

review:
FI GA TA! Praticamente Kerbal per la costruzione delle auto, con però molto più livello di controllo in quanto non esistono moduli già preconfezionati ma devi costruirti tutto un po come con il meccano (per chi se lo ricorda).

Diciamo che arrivi a capire da solo come mai molti ponti abbiano strutture a triangoli alternati :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198183916929', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 27, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1712075122}
review:
Хорошая игра. Бесконечный конструктор. В первом обзоре писал, что не хватает координат. Так вот мне их все еще очень не хватает. Особенно, когда строишь в самой мелкой сетке.
К сожалению, по крайней мере на данный момент, мне кажется, что в игре нельзя построить такие типы подвесок, как макферсон и многорычажку. Торсионная балка тоже будет вести себя просто как мост. И стабилизатор попеперечной устойчивости у меня тоже не получилось сконструировать.
Скорее всего, я просто слишком придираюсь к игре.

upd: В общем, спустя 57 часов в игре, я построил все виды подвесок. От жестких балок, до многорычажки вкруг. Придумал как воплотить стабилизатор поперечной устойчивости. Игра самый настоящий конструктор, с возможностью сделать из прямой балки все, что хочешь. Нужно лишь немного подумать о кинематике. А не ждать готовых решений из авто индустрии. Это очень крутая игра!
developer_response: В игре есть гайд с конструированием простейшей машинки. Как раз, таки: клавиша F1 в редакторе. Там и надпись есть слева сверху экрана: F1 - Tutorial

author: {'steamid': '76561198137548137', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1691020424}
review:
If you are interested in automotive engineering, mechanical engineering, or engineering design then I do not just suggest this game, I beg you to play it. I have spent time trying to make things in other vehicle simulation games, and none of them come CLOSE to the amazing amount of customization you can use. It has a very small learning curve, but once you figure it out, it is by far the best game for those interested in automotive engineering. It is challenging, but once you get a car to function just like you imagined it, it is an amazing payoff of satisfaction. This is the best $10 I've ever spent on a game, and I would have been just as content spending 30 with a few updates.

Screw undertale, screw fnaf, screw shovel knight, this is the indie game people should be drooling over

author: {'steamid': '76561198115842733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4334, 'last_played': 1682650551}
review:
Yeah I like this game a lot, and the potential for real fun videos is through the roof. Great driving mechanics, there's a lot to learn but with something this in depth it is kinda to be expected.

Pros: 
-Decent Racing sim altogether
-intuitive car/airplane building 
-easy to make maps for
-multiplayer

Cons: 
-No meaningful updates in a long time
-Soft Body physics reminds me of those old bridge builder games, not totally realistic when applied to cars
-Dwindling community
-Steep difficulty in single player

author: {'steamid': '76561198432272009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1681408354}

author: {'steamid': '76561198848742600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1602875284}
review:
It's a good game in my opinion but not for everybody. I can see how some of the game elements might make it boring from the get-go. If you're looking for a fun game that has no real endpoint just to mess about using cars and maps from the workshop, then this is it. 

Not the realistic type of car game. Wanna put a jet on a Lambo? Go ahead. But I guess some people would get bored very quickly by the lack of a direction in the game and lack of activities surrounding you building that car.

The races are not very well designed (prob cause their randomly generated), and gets rather repetitive after a few hours. Honestly, the only driving factor in the game is you improving your own car to the point at which you are happy enough with it, and the cars and maps from the workshop, some of which are amazing.

The 'car building' mechanism is not as realistic as I would like it to be, but on the other hand, don't expect this to be need for speed style car tuning. It's much more focused on the frame of the car and it's physics rather than aesthetics. You can't play with the engine, as in adding a turbo, or the type of engine (V8, I6, etc.) and the sound that the engine makes is very dull and generic. 

In conclusion, don't buy this game if you are not into the car building mechanism of it. This is also not really a racing game in my opinion. Doesn't classify as a simulator or as an arcade in my opinion, but I like it's
uniqueness. THIS SHOULD NOT BE YOUR FIRST CAR RELATED GAME WHATSOEVER!!! If you want to get into car games, this should not be your first choice, considering the fact that you'll most likely find it boring in the first 50 mins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255403611', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1593978715}

author: {'steamid': '76561198180382099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1577731481}
review:
Its pretty fun. The tools arent the most user friendly and there are some missing quality of life options but if you like physics sandbox simulators, this is right up your alley.

Youll try to spend 5 minutes and soon enough itll be the next day.

Obviously not finished, simple player is basically non existent, but the Sandbox mode, (which is also single player but not campaign mode) is where I imagine most people spend their time completing races against other players times. (You can see the ghost of the other players and their funky designs).

author: {'steamid': '76561198143394895', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7539, 'last_played': 1624621061}
review:
对悬挂和车体的模拟，作为一个游戏来讲真的是很hardcore了，开2khz物理频率以后基本可以模拟出大多数实际上存在的悬挂系统工作特点，不能理解的话自己去游戏里做一套双A和麦弗逊和扭力梁就明白了。

避震算是2way吧，要是把高低速回弹也做出来的话就没法玩了，但是弹簧的K值和预压也是可以调节的，所以基本上可以模拟出你想要的大多数底盘。

好玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198197954525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 129216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126179, 'last_played': 1589789285}
review: This is a nice game for thinkers and builders.  While you won't get the same effect as a full fledged racing game, this actually employs a different type of focus, that being the build/test/refine/post your creation type.  There are so many ways to build a rolling, steering, powered chassis -- with wheel sizes, shocks, horsepower option to get you your "Dream Car" as you refine and test it on numerous workshop posted tracks/maps that cover the terrain spectrum from flat out tarmac to impossible rock crawls.  My favorite feature is the ability to upload your own 3-D objects (called decorations) which could be anything from complex model car bodies/motors (with working doors, etc.) to simple parts to enhance your car's appearance.    The only downside I have is the lack of higher quality color or finishes that would make the cars look a bit more realistic.  Coloring parts is done with a basic slider selection type, without ability to save user defined colors and as yet, nothing close to chrome as a material finish.   If you ever thought you could build the best Go-Cart, Baja Buggy, or you have a better way of designing a suspension system, this game is unique fun on several levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078210202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 11196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7905, 'last_played': 1708800332}
review:
Отличная игрушка. Пусть графика и сам геймплей довольно примитивны, но возможности в конструировании разных машин тут ограничены только воображением игрока. Можно построить какой-нибудь дорожный седдан, автобус с гармошкой, болид формулы один. Как я понимаю, можно строить даже вертолёты. Но, игра явно не для всех. Тут нет каких-то блоков, которые просто можно прилепить друг к другу и получить автомобиль. Всё делается из самых базовых элементов, вроде рам, нужно продумывать каркас машины, подвеску и т.д., чтобы всё не развалилось при появлении на карте. Физика работает неплохо - покрышки деформируются под нагрузкой, можно создавать сложные механизмы, вроде активной аэродинамики или push rod подвески. 
Однозначно рекомендую любителям конструкторов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268073093', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9449, 'last_played': 1704373569}
review:
Ever since i came back to this game about 1 and a half months ago, i started to enjoy it as i really like to build and create cars in certain ways that they can be anything from little carts to big trucks and more!

However, there are a lot of things that either bother me or block me from my progress when building cars.

First off, it's kinda weird that frames themselfes don't have a collision model only the connection points have one.

Secondly, there is nothing like self collision which can be annoying if you try to build a car a certain way.(Would be cool to have it an option to enable or disable it or when a frame is visibly hidden that it then doesn't have a collision but when not hidden it does have one.)

And thirdly, this has not really to do with the game but people miss you on the discord community server.

That's all from me and i hope i didn't forget anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273546826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1699181844}
review:
Игрой это назвать как то язык не поворачивается, т.к. это самый натуральный автосимулятор и не только(особенно если учесть, что нынче всё что угодно называется симом), а точнее симулякр, с возможностью построить что угодно. Игра позволяет построить не только тачки, но и летающие самолёты и вертолёты. При этом народ умудряется делать махолёты, т.е искусственных птиц. Вот только тут нет полной поддержки игровых рулей. Вернее не работает так называемый Force feedback, т.е. нет передачи усилий от колёс на руль. Руль работает просто в пружинном режиме. Но зато управление можно нормально настроить под аналоговый геймпад. Даже без Force feedback'а на руле, вы будете просто в шоке от достоверности поведения автомобиля, при условии что тачка будет правильной. Это я вам говорю как довольно опытный автосиммер.
Тут всё состоит только из идеализированных палок, шарниров, колёс, пружин с амортами, гидравлики, валов, движков и панелей(плоскостей). Палки обладают упругостью и прочностью, но не имеют пластичности. В смысле, есть только упругие деформации, без остаточных деформаций. Прочность реализована условно, т.е. при определённой упругой деформации палка ломается(исчезает). Всё это конечно же настраивается, и можно получить любую прочность и упругость. Шарниры(соединения) представляют собой идеализированный шаровый шарнир. Таким образом, используя треугольники можно строить простые силовые каркасы. Ну и из этого можно построить любую тачку(и не только). Игра нормально идёт на довольно слабых ноутбуках со встроенной графикой. Лишь бы процессор был поприличнее. На конец 2019 года нормальный онлайн ещё не завезли. Чтобы полностью разобраться в игре без просмотра всяких гайдов в тырнете, мне потребовалось не более двух дней. В общем игра определённо стоит своих очень небольших денег. Вернее её отдают практически бесплатно.
developer_response: Спасибо за отзыв! Игровой руль должен работать. У вас не работает? По крайней мере, на старом noname руле с педалью газа и тормоза у меня все работало.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271942231', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1631864207}
review:
I love this game, but me and my friend cant seem to get the multiplayer to work, can anyone help us out? i downloaded the DCB Server tool and ran it, i was able to join on my PC but it doesn't show up for my fiend.
otherwise, great game!
developer_response:
Thanks for the review!
Please read this guide:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1632023964
(It seems you didn't forward server ports if you use a router. If all is correct, you see two the same servers in the game in this case: one is from your local network, and one is from the internet.) 

"In order to host a server, you must have the server ports open and forwarded for UDP and TCP connections (if you use a router), OTHERWISE, YOUR SERVER WILL NOT BE VISIBLE FROM THE INTERNET!"

You can find the information of how to forward server ports for your router model in the internet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088829328', 'num_games_owned': 2963, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1563331638}
review:
Brilliant. 

I bought 2 other building games today after selling off a good proportion of my steam cards, out of the three games, which were:-

Brick Inventions, 
Rover Builder & 
Dream Car Builder, 

This didn`t really jump out at me as being particularly intuitive or easy to build with. 
Don`t ask me why but at first glance it looks complicated and hard to grasp.

It isn`t.

The tutorial is easy to understand, and most object placing and editing is intuitive. 
It IS very flexible and you have a large choice of materials & parts to make use of. 
Your cars can be as simple or as complex as you like.

Testing your creation on the maps provided is a blast in itself & great fun.
Back in the dim and distant past I participated and competed in a lot of real life motorsport hill climbs in a very tatty, old, roll cage equipped mk 1 Ford Escort, This game is the closest I`ve seen to recreating the experience of hill climbing, but in a video game. (Choosing the right route when climbing a steep hill, is everything, and is close to what you have to do in real life).

I haven`t yet tackled the  actual game or multiplayer aspects of this, as I`ve always preferred the sandbox or creative mode in building games like this, No restrictions on parts and build to your hearts content basically.
But just an hour playing only that aspect of this game has already convinced me that I`ve got my moneys worth.

Its on sale at the moment for £4.45 and worth every penny.

Good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088635908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36266, 'last_played': 1711002765}
review:
This has been one of the best build and race games I have played. In singleplayer mode, you can drive around the map to earn coins, and then upgrade your engine, tires, or the weight to strength ratio of other parts. And in sandbox mode, mode, you can have as many engines as you want, and you can also add jets. If you want to build a vehicle however you want, and think you can figure out a 3D version of Dream Car Racing 1, 2, or Evo, then I recommend you try this game.
I might add more to the review later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087679021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1564120441}
review:
This is a rather brilliant way to allow one's mechanical and kinematic imagination to run wild... Unfortunately my ideas for suspension and the like are rather simple. solid axles front and rear and prone to tip over. What matters however is the astounding amount of different ways one can configure a vehicle and it's suspension.

Now if only it had leaf springs, then my suspension designs can be even more primitive...

Какая у вас операционная система 32 или 64 бит?

Нужно сделать следующее: 
1. Попробуйте зайти в песочницу
2. Не выключая игру, найдите файл "C:\Users\YourUsername\AppData\LocalLow\RoKo0\Dream Car Builder\output_log.txt" и отправьте его мне на почту dreamcarracing3d@gmail.com

Тогда я, возможно, смогу определить причину зависания.

review:
Budowanie swojego pojazdu jest tak trudne i czasochłonne że ma się tak ogromną satysfakcje z zrobienia jednej części swojego pojazdu, jak przy ukończeniu fabuły w GTA i wyskoczeniu napisów końcowych

+ Ma MP

- Hamulec jest automatycznie powiązany z cofaniem (mogło by być rozwiązane chociaż tak, że żeby cofać to trzeba by było znów wcisnąć S)
- Zbyt czasochłonne budowanie działających mechanizmów...

author: {'steamid': '76561198163007037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1650286552}
review:
When I found this game, I thought I had found a little gem in the steam store.

By god was I wrong, I've spent hours upon hours watching tutorials, reading guides, experimenting with different designs. To find that this game is absolutely terrible, the UI fights your every input into design and if you somehow manage to even get past that, you'll be pleasantly surprised when you find out the physics engine is absolute garbage.

I've currently applied for a refund of this game despite having multiple hours as I personally feel that it doesn't meet the standards that a game of this price should. And that doesn't meet consumer rights standards in my country.

I in no intentional manner wish to make the Developer feel negatively, I think the game could work if given time and significantly more development into things such as physics or ease of access when designing. But currently the game doesn't meet standards as the cars feel like they're made of paper and the car bounces around like a rubber ball. I think it's also important to note that points on frames do not act as if they're welded, this means that frames bounce around and fly apart usually before a vehicle begins to move. Parts can be locked in certain angles but the system is still glitchy and often doesn't perform as it should. I think a more conventional and intuitive way to design this would be to have points on frames locked initially and make axis' placeable after this.

In conclusion the game doesn't perform as expected or promised and the trailer and multiple positive reviews are very misleading in this matter. Do not fall for the trap I did in believing it is you who is terrible and not the game.

- An annoyed player, who's probably never gonna get his $14.50 back
developer_response:
"frames bounce around and fly apart usually before a vehicle begins to move"

- It is not easy to build a car frame. Look at thousands of successful examples of other people for this game:
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/browse/?appid=488550&requiredtags%5B0%5D=Cars&actualsort=trend&browsesort=trend&p=1&days=-1

author: {'steamid': '76561198017246905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 4498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2174, 'last_played': 1654448401}
review:
This game is a little hidden gem, if you like engineering things and then testing them, then tweaking them for better performance this game is for you, it's more of a simulator than anything else.

Everything effects the vehicle you build, weight, camber, toe in - out, drag and probably the most rewarding part is building a suspension system that is fully functional. 

You can add panels and paint everything, just check out some of the amazing things made in the workshop, the game itself runs so smooth even on old systems, there isn't much of progression system because the game is focused around being a sandbox. It really is rewarding to build something from scratch. 

There are no limits to what you can build, it all comes down to your creativity and skill in engineering. 

Locking diffs, tyre sizes, width, weight, roll bars i mean it goes on and on and on.  I highly suggest you buy the game and build something amazing. It will take some time since it's complicated but dam, it's awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144989988', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1707717466}
review: Reallllly well designed and fun building simulator. The pictures shown in the store page for this game dont show the full picture. The community has made some reallllly impressive vehicles, from planes, to jets, rocketships, helicopters, F1 cars, dune buggies, monster trucks and everything in between. There is alloooot of customization which can seem intimidating at first but the tutorial is alright and within 5 hours, you will pick up everything. The maps are designed well enough so that you can put any vehicle through any kind of test. LITERALLY ANYTHING. I personally love just trying community vehicles and modifying them to make them even better. Only about 15 hours in, did I make my own first full car, because I had to learn alooot about suspension and turning and implementing actual car systems using the materials given. Defenitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960273224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1555512649}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027446195', 'num_games_owned': 1779, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 5672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1703972638}
review:
Most fun prototyping, stunt driving, rock climbing, and crash test dummy simulator I've played in a long time; with a car editor, track editor, and a good deal of workshop content.

There's no real multiplayer, but it does leave ghosts for others to challenge/enjoy the show via track editing (make your own race track on any map; have your own high score board; or heck, a stunt show spot. Sorry to anyone's times I may have obliterated due to Gran Turismo experience. And speaking of Gran Turismo, the physics of this game are good enough to set time trials; we just need some race tracks now. And more tracks that make good use of stunts, and the crash physics overall.

Controller/gamepad recommended if you want to have better control over the throttle and brakes, and other conveniences to make driving a little more fun. Especially, after crashing a few times and racing a few tracks, practicing some drifting with all kinds of cars, including the classic Model-T, a tank, 787-B, the Batmobile, or an A-10 Warthog (making a different set of Brrrt noises).

UPDATE:
Can you beat my Reliant Robin track times? I left a few, here and there. I hope you know how to drift one. Crash Test Site has a good practice spot/track I left behind to get some practice in (slalom area). Have fun beating my times.
developer_response: Thanks for the review, I will release the beta version of the realtime multiplayer soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128470023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1546305313}
review:
Absolutely brilliant concept and execution.  And so much fun!

I think of DCB is an advanced automotive design and simulation tool first, and a game second.  Because, what better way to immediately show the effects of your changes than this:  try your changed design on a racecourse, racing against your best-ever run, which appears as an opponent.  You immediately see what you did and how it affects everything else.*

And you can change everything: geometry, stiffness, weight, friction, damping, etc.  Not to mention style, color, decoration etc.  

Best of all, the racing is FUN.  Truly, the KSP of car design...there's nothing else like it or remotely as good.

*It's an optimization problem where a little change affects many other things.  Best to make small changes.

review:

developer_response:
The game's price is $14.99 . Where you find it for over 20 dollars?

I think this game is not for you. It is not an arcade game where you assemble a vehicle from a few blocks. if you can't create a car with working suspension and steering system like other people, this is not the fault of this game.

It is like to say: "This hammer is bad because there is no tutorial on how to build a house."

But the game has the tutorial, that help you to build a first simple car. If you want  to build something more difficult, use ingame examples, other cars from the game server or workshop, use guids on the game's community hub, and youtube tutorials.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367536106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1691837789}
review: there should be a way to import a car body mesh. I would re-download if this was possible.
developer_response:
1. The tutorial has an example of how to build a simple car.
2. Each part has the description (quistion icon on the right-top of the part's window)
3. Each part's parameter has the tool tip.
4. Some video tutorials on steam: https://steamcommunity.com/app/488550/guides/
5. Some video tutorials on youtube: https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=dream+car+builder+tutorial

6. I think this game is too difficult for you, you could read the description of the game before buying it: "Designing the perfect frame and steering system is no simple matter."

author: {'steamid': '76561198057003504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3689, 'last_played': 1635670306}
review:
For me, there's no other game that even comes close to this. I like to tinker and make stuff; I've tried many sandbox building games to scratch that itch, but have always felt limited by the builder. Many building games dumb down the builder in order to retain mainstream appeal.

Dream Car Builder is like the polar opposite of that; it's made for the natural born tinkerers and wannabe engineers. The builder looks more like a CAD program than a video game! (but the learning curve is still easy)

Right now, I'm trying to build a car with realistic wishbone suspension, and I'm actually having to do research on suspension geometry and apply real-world principles with the roll centre, caster angle, scrub radius, etc. in order to perfect the handling. Making changes to the shock absorbers and swaybars has the same effects on understeer and oversteer as it does in real life and in sim-racing games. If that sounds like fun to you, then buy this game now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285052313', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12457, 'last_played': 1611272349}
review: There is nothing like this game. Full control of vehicle creation, easy to create maps in Unity and great developer support. Constantly getting updates adding more and more features.

review:
[b]Önceklikle hayal ederek tasarlayıp, sonrasında oyun içerisinde ekipmanlarınızı konumlandırarak aracınızı üretmeye başladığınız bu oyunda, tasarımınızın en son halinde adeta dokunarak gerçekçi bir şekilde test etme imkanı buluyorsunuz. Kendinize uygun bulduğunuz aracı seçerseniz, sonrasındaki tasarım aşamasında gelecek eklentileri en kullanışlı biçimde ekleyip, işlevsel bir hale sokmak daha imkanlı bir hale gelecektir. Son aşamalarda tasarladığınız araçları, oyunun test çeşitliliği içerisinde verdiği tepkilere bakarak kendinize göre neyi doğru, neyi yanlış yaptığınızı görebilirsiniz. Bütün bu eksiklikleri ve yapılması gerekenleri yaptıktan sonra da, aracınızın diğer araçlarla karşılaştırıp, performansını test edebilirsiniz.

🌟 Diğer oyun incelemelerini bulabileceğiniz [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25772060/] KÜRATÖR [/url] sayfasına gitmek için [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25772060/] Tıklayabilirsiniz. [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198291670995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1669723012}
review:
自分で車をデザインできることに興味を惹かれました。

最初は、操作方法や車の作り方が分からなかったのでパブリッシュカーで遊んでいましたが、オリジナルの車を作りたくなり、試行錯誤しながら簡単な車を作れるようになりました。

複雑な手の込んだ車を作るには、それなりに時間と労力を要しますが、その過程も楽しい。トライアンドエラーを繰り返しながら、少しづつ車が出来ていく面白さは他では味わえません。

3Dオブジェクトをロードすれば、流線型のボディや独自のパーツなどが使用できるため、実在の車に極限まで近づけることも可能になりました。また、この手のゲームでは珍しく日本語にも対応しているので、非常に分かりやすいです。

他の人が作った車を走らせたり、実際にはあり得ないような車を作ったり、車を壊して遊んだり(笑)・・・楽しみ方は無限大です。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996903955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 205, 'playtime_at_review': 2438, 'last_played': 1712446133}

This game is totally awesome.
You can create your own cars, tune them and test. There is a ton of stuff in a workshop. Game get constant upgrades and actualisations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986331179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4815, 'last_played': 1542159188}
review:
Unityで開発された乗り物制作のサンドボックスです

チュートリアルからUIまでちゃんと日本語になってます
ゲーム的には殆ど目的らしいものは無いため（実績解除の為にシングルプレイがあるくらい？）、実績に特にこだわりがなければサンドボックスでも問題ないかと
サンドボックスでもチュートリアルが見れます

乗り物の組み立ては三角で構成されている事が基本になります、四角以上で組んでもそのままでは潰れてしまうので組んだ後に角度の固定を入れる必要があります
他の方の指摘通り最初はワークショップに上がってる作品を参考にしながらプレイしました

またゲーム内でobjファイルをインポートし色付け出来る様になってるため、blender等モデリングソフトからエクスポートすれば簡単に乗り物へ設置できます
またオリジナルマップ作成はUnityそのものを用いるようで弄れる人は様々なマップが出来ると思います

かつてPSのパネキットからBesiege、KSP等、細かいことはいいから乗り物作ってみたい人は楽しめます

author: {'steamid': '76561198318185593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 8073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1712137542}
review:
这游戏很好，推出两个建议：
  1.可以试着加入火炮和装甲的元素，火炮可以设置初速，弹丸重量，这二者就可以得到相应的后坐力，装甲可以直接加在面板里，可以设置厚度，重量随厚度增加。以及倾斜装甲的跳弹算法。
  2.加入油箱和弹药库的设定，以及炮塔绞盘部件，
这样你就可以多了两个 DLC,售价涨一倍也有人买的，而且用户群比现在大得多。

author: {'steamid': '76561197982442586', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1572175865}
review:
Nice game if you enjoy building pipechasis cars by your self. Game do not need latest graphics cards so it runs really well on older pc's. I wish there was easy way to make rigid joints and easier way to make plates in car editor, but this is still in development. Devs are really proactive and have made lots of examples for player to watch in editor. This is some what complex game so i recommend it players why like to learn mechanics and enjoy building their own stuff. 

Game doesnt have real online fumction but it records other players driving ghost so you can still compete with other players without getting harrashed by mingebags. You can save your own made cars to HDD or publish in workshop.

TL;DR: Nice building game with good physic simulation that goes well with older pc's. No Real-Time online races but competitive other players driving ghost. Active Devs and lots of updates.

review:
[b]If you like customizing things in games and building things, this game is definitely for you. Yes, there is a pretty good learning curve to the game, but any game with a lot of options and possiblities will have that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127657404', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3312, 'last_played': 1688501535}
review: [h1]Введение[/h1]Приобрел игру на свои кровные по совету друга, и не пожалел. В этом обзоре я подробно распишу все аспекты игры, что мне понравилось а что нет, и что я хотел бы видеть в следующих обновлениях. Стоит понимать, что это авто- и авиаконструктор, и если ты ничего в этом не понимаешь, или даже не хочешь понимать, то эта игра для тебя не подойдет.[h1]Достоинства игры[/h1][list]    [*]Самое главное достоинство игры - [b]Физика[/b]. Ты поиграл в огромное количество сандбокс игр с возможностью создания своих автомобилей, но так и не нашел игру где можно сделать реалистичную подвеску? Тогда это то, что тебе нужно! Ещё здесь можно сделать машину с физикой мягких тел, на подобии beamng (Можно увидеть на скриншотах игры). А так же присутствует физика покрышек, а именно, изменение давления шин и сцепление с поверхностью (Зависит от протектора).    [*][b]Аэродинамика[/b]. Очень порадовала возможность создать РАБОЧИЙ СПОЙЛЕР или полностью аэродинамичный кузов, такого я не видел ни в одной игре.    [*][b]Интерфейс[/b]. Простой и понятный интерфейс, нет ничего лишнего.    [*]Возможность загрузить .Obj объект. Этот пункт очень понравится людям, которые хоть немного умеют моделировать в 3D редакторах (Blender, 3Dmax). Ты можешь загрузить модель машины, и сделать для нее подвеску. По моему это очень крутая возможность. Также модель может подвергаться деформации.    [*][b]Большие карты[/b]. Как и в любой порядочной сандбокс игре, у пользователя есть возможность создать свою карту. (Создается с помощью Unity)    [*][b]Оптимизация[/b]. Сразу обратил внимание на оптимизацию. Я играю на системе i5-2400 и gtx 1050. На высокой графике в Full HD игре нет резкого дропа кадров. Также фпс значительно не садится от большого количества деталей.[/list][h1]Недостатки[/h1][list]    [*]Честно говоря, для себя не выявил недостатков.[/list][h1]Что я хотел бы увидеть в дальнейшем[/h1][list]    [*]Передвижение точек  по осям с помощью стрелочек X Y Z(Как в 3D редакторах), чтобы строить корпуса с большей точностью.    [*]Создание намертво зафиксированной точки. ?    [*]Пропеллеры для поршневых самолетов.    [*]Траки для создания танковых подвесок и модельки танковых катков. ?    [*]Катера и физика воды. ?[/list]Это мое субъективное мнение, если вы с чем-то не согласны пишите в комментарии.Буду обновлять по мере обновления игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051166380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1709036018}
review:
ゲームタイトルの通り夢の自動車をつくれる楽しいゲームです

おすすめできる点はシンプルな操作と優れたUIです、だいたい直感でなんとかなります
個人的にうれしい点はゲームが軽くて丈夫なところです、ロード自体はありますがそれらのほとんどがとても短時間で終了します、頻繫に起こるようなバグもなく、サンドボックス系共通のストレス要因をうまく回避してあるゲームだと思います

悪い点をあげるとするならばサンドボックス系にしては数値が限定的で、必要十分ではあるけれどやっぱりもう少し欲しいかなという点です
数値というのは、例えばサスペンション硬度の最低値が５００まであります、この数値はサスペンションとして使用する最低値としては十分だけれども他の部品に使おうとすると強すぎるとかそういった感じです

しかしこのゲームを楽しむ上で上記の点は本当に些細なもので、ゲーム自体の完成度はとても高く、素晴らしいゲームに仕上がっていると私は思います

いろんな事を試してみたい、さまざまな状況をテストしたい、そんな"夢"を持つあなたに自信を持ってオススメできるゲームです

author: {'steamid': '76561197972980777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1537908991}
review: Jogo tem uma ideia interessante no que se refere a construir carros e pensar estruturas. Porém peguei o jogo por causa do Multiplayer, conforme descrição na pág do jogo... Os devs precisam entender o conceito de Multiplayer, correr contra fantasmas de outros jogadores com certeza não é a definição de Multiplayer.
developer_response:
Just read the description of the game:

Attention: You can compete with your friends, see their cars, create tracks and setup conditions for each race. But you cannot collide with the other players' cars. This is not a realtime multi-player game!

Look at this famous game, for example: https://store.steampowered.com/app/289070/Sid_Meiers_Civilization_VI/
This game has "muilti-player" tag, but players can't interact with each other at the same time. But this is a multi-player game, because, players still compete with each other.

I am working on the realtime-multiplayer for Dream Car Builder, but it is a very difficult task. No one has ever done multiplayer for the soft-body physics. Look at BeamNG.Drive: they can't make the realtime multiplayer and even ghosts although there are more than 30 people working on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105526957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4934, 'last_played': 1590125871}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001794713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1537819485}
review:
I was drawn in by the videos and positive reviews, but damn does this game not play well. 

The actual driving physics are so awkward and overall weird. The car bounces around like its made out of rubber, puts out a stock crash sound and is damaged by the slightest bump. Like the wheels get broken off by the most simple dirt road......

Yeah, definitely not my type of game and I think a lot of folks wont like it either, its not a simulation or a fun arcade physics box.....
developer_response:
It is "Dream Car Builder", but you didn't build anything (you played only 20 minutes). 
You just loaded some bad cars and tried them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125047691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1537803934}
review:
给想买的各位一些建议：
1 这游戏不是赛车类游戏而是创造沙盒类游戏（像围攻和废品机械师那样的）车的驾驶手感不想其他赛车游戏那样有手感
2 此游戏适合那些愿意花时间琢磨的人群，像我这样的看见界面就一脸问号还不愿意花时间琢磨的就别考虑了
游戏绝对是好游戏，但可能大多数人不喜欢

author: {'steamid': '76561198098559286', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2216, 'last_played': 1706298141}
review:
I got this game about 4 days ago and I've already sunken 20 hours into it.

The thing I love the most about it is its simplicity. You are given minimal tools in an easy to use editor, and given the freedom to create whatever you want. The result is a game where the end goal is set by you.

The games mechanics are also unique. Most vehicle creation games on steam are grid based (Beseige, Scrap Mechanic, Trailblazers, ect.) which allows this game to stick out.

I highly recomend this game to anyone looking for a unique, challenging and fun vehicle creator / sim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101836682', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1578153930}

author: {'steamid': '76561198321349224', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1686615699}
review:
I love this game, I Havent been off of it since i got it. I recommend this to anyone with a creative mind but its a game for everyone. The developer has really done well with this one i hope its out of early access very soon. -MarrsI

author: {'steamid': '76561198267445014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 86, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1712294231}
review:
I am an engineer who spends all day working with 3D modelling software. Simply put, Dream Car Builder is what I wish I was using all day at work. The game allows for the creation of an incredibly diverse selection of vehicles, aircraft, and so on, but this is not some cheesy cut-and-paste building system, this is almost more like CAD, (albiet infinitiely more fun to use). The interface is simple, and easy to navigate, and the design control menus are well laid out and very clear. 

The player is resposible for every aspect of the design, but having a familiarity with CAD is by no means necessary to enjoy the game. Being able to see and feel changes applied to a vehicle's dynamics in the garage while cruising around one of the many maps, makes Dream Car Builder unique. Just playing the game and refining a design can help to develop a real understanding of the way the physical world interacts with a mechanical system. Beginners can start with some of the excellent work posted to the workshop, modify them, or start their own designs from scratch. For advanced players of Dream Car Builder, the sky is the limit. Excellent game, and it gets better with every update. Strongly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153239971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1636566266}
review:
I don't think it's a game for everyone but if you enjoy games like besiege and Kerbal Space Program for the vehicle construction, you have to try Dream car builder. It doesn't offer much in terms of objectives (outside of the vehicle construction it's just a racing game with objectives consisting of going from point A to point B) but I think the vehicle building mechanics are a step above anything else I have seen so far because of a simple detail: a single part cannot do anything by itself.

Let me explain:
In besiege, if you want to steer, you add a part that steers.
In DCB, if you want to steer, you have to arrange a combination of frame and rod parts that will make the wheels turn. So far I must have found 10 different ways to steer.
It's the same for Shocks and Wings (yes there are wings but no aerial race yet).

author: {'steamid': '76561198029677588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3195, 'last_played': 1591563760}
review:
Long Review Short for those who don't want to exand this to read it all: If you like Beseige, Trail Makers, Brick Rigs, or Scrap Mechanic, you should get this.

I have and am still having fun with this. Really solid engine that translates your designs pretty accurately into driving dynamics, decent enough graphics for such an open ended game (physics and sandbox = very heavy requirements if you go nuts with it). Community really makes this game, with the developer popping into the forums regularly for feedback.

Really the only thing I think the game needs to improve on is the campaign mode, which is basically the sandbox mode and a giant fetch quest to upgrade part stats. Races could use some work, though again this is a small dev team so multiplayer or multiple vehicles ingame with collisions would be hard to make work without tanking even the best PC.

Performance wise, it runs well on my outdated FX-8120 CPU (overclocked) until you get past a certain point with part count and it tanks, as well as running on the advanced simulation rate setting. On most modern (last 5 years on intel or any Ryzen) desktop CPUs it should be fine, as well as gaming mobile chips (intel H,HK, or HQ CPUs. AMD Ryzen 5 or 7 mobile APUs should be good too).

Bugs? only found one and it might be tied to the Unity engine. when changing the graphics settings, many UI elements and textures fail to load properly. Again, early access so it will likely be fixed soon enough.

If you enjoy engineering, tweaking and tinkering with designs from others or yourself, then you should give this game a long look.

I will update this after the official launch and after major updates beyond.

System Specs:
CPU: FX- 8120 @ 3.9 GHz
GPU: R9 290X
RAM: 16 GB (4x4 GB)
OS on SSD, game on HDD
