author: {'steamid': '76561198271790933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 110258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 125, 'playtime_at_review': 25780, 'last_played': 1712344767}
review:
フレーム・エンジン・タイヤなどの部品を使用して様々な車両を組み上げ、世界中のプレイヤー達とタイムアタックをする事が出来ます。
フレームの太さやタイヤの空気圧など部品には複数の設定箇所があり、設定を変える事で車両特性を変化させる事が出来ます。
シャシーやサスペンションアームの形状・取り付け位置を変える事でシャシージオメトリを変化させ、多様なセッティングを試す事が出来ます。
車両構築が苦手であればワークショップの車両を使用して車両構造の理解を深める事をお勧めします。
自動車やRCカーに精通している方であれば自分の思うとおりの車両を構築出来るのではないかと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197966527290', 'num_games_owned': 3794, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1488995797}
review:
C’est trop facile de se moquer d’un jeu moche. Non, vraiment. Surtout quand il enchaîne les clichés du jeu moche. Dream Car Racing 3D est réellement hideux avec ses quelques textures, sa skybox honteuse et toutes ses modélisations qu’on n’ose même pas afficher. Néanmoins, un rictus et deux facepalm plus tard, on se rend compte que Dream Car Racing 3D est un Early Access finalement prometteur.

Non pas que le jeu devienne bon, magnifique, profond… Mais il se révèle assez passionnant pour les designers en herbe. En effet, dans le garage du jeu, il est possible de concevoir entièrement sa voiture. Au fil de courses générées aléatoirement dans une carte vide (d’autres, tout aussi vides, sont disponibles sur le Steam Workshop gratuitement), vous gagnerez des pièces vous permettant d’améliorer vos morceaux de tôles. Tout cela pour faire de votre voiture la plus puissante, en un mot la meilleure.

Alors non, Dream Car Racing 3D ne sera jamais un bon jeu. Mais voir un projet si humble débarquer en Early Access, voir des gens y contribuer en créant et partageant sur le Workshop, juste parce qu’une seule idée est parvenue à le sortir du lot… ça force le respect malgré tout.

Et si c’était ça, le but d’un Early Access ? Permettre à un créateur de trouver un public pour l’améliorer. Un public conscient que le projet sera jamais merveilleux. Mais au final, si tout le monde y trouve son compte ? ** petits oiseaux qui chantent, optimisme, tout ça **

author: {'steamid': '76561198203342489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1574, 'last_played': 1657431090}
review: This game is an amazing improvement over previous dream car iterations with the 3D adding a new dimension of challenge to the builders. I got this game as soon as I could and love experimenting with the various building materials available to me. The game provides a number of ways for you to play it and the workshop is just as healthy and full of creative people as in other iterations of the game! My only real complaint for this game is that figuring out the steering system is a little bit complicated and involves a lot of trial and error, that being said, I still highly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066239076', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3088, 'last_played': 1656624766}
review: By far a very good game for anyone interested in creating cars and the like. Building is simple but can be as complex as you like, and vehicles behave exactly how they should. Your creativity is your only restrictions and with an active player base and dev, theres always new stuff to check out. If you like building cars and dont mind learning some extensive controls, this would be a wonderfull game to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107593629', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 17607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10627, 'last_played': 1703000103}
review:
This is a Sandbox car building game where you literally control every aspect of the car. That being said it is not easy, and if you're not up for a challenge of building a car, there is an option to download other players' cars off of Steam's Workshop. Personally I enjoy spending hour at a time making a car perfect at what it does, and if you enjoy a physics puzzle in a car like me, this is definitely what you've been waiting for, I know it's what I've always wanted, thank you RoKo0.

-Update: A bunch of things have been added, but probably the biggest are; Angle Lock, Jet Engines, and Aerodynamics. With these new updates you can build planes, jet dragsters, and much more sturdy vehicles. One of the most entertaining things about the Aerodynamics is the ability to build incredibly fast racecars. Before you had no downforce, no matter what, but now you can add downforce, to help corners, air resistance, for an air brake, and so much more. The puzzle I speak of has been given more pieces, and am loving every update for the game. Once again, thank you Roko0.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010900268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1595719089}
review: perfect game for people who like to build/ design, or even tinker with things. if you like bridge building games or physics baised games you might like this game. if you can think of an idea you can build it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982284657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1658497600}
review:
This is all as of January 1, 2017 This could all change at the very next update!

I wasn't sure what to expect from this game. The further I dive in I find you truly can create any 'at the time of writing' ground based vehicles. For me I have chosen a design inspired from Elio Motors because to my surprise no one on the workshop had even tried! So this tells me there is room for creative designs from all works of peoples. 


I highly recommend this but remember this is very early and things take time.

Cons:
This game is physics based so things can get wonky as one would espect "Go Easy on the Dev!"

-Parts are sometimes hard to select in the editor
-Wheels can sometimes clip into the ground causing oddities.
-There is officially one main level (There are modded ones.)

Pros: 
-You can literally build any ground based that comes to mind.
-You can mod maps and potentially parts as well.
-It has a very fun upgrade system to make your parts stronger,faster,more weight,etc..
-Each part in itself is scalable and can be painted to look very nice!

I'm excited to see where this game goes in the year ahead of us! Great Job Dev!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069003932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 2453, 'last_played': 1711254946}
review:
Gra daje niesamowite możliwości każdemu, kto chciałby stworzyć w grze pojazd i się nim ścigać i bawić. Samochody, motocykle, jeżdżące domy, ciężarówki, czołgi, motocykle, quady - możesz zrobić co chcesz, a jeśli tylko potrafisz to stworzysz coś naprawdę fajnego.
Ja tą grą jestem zachwycony i naprawdę czerpię z niej bardzo dużo frajdy i radości. To jest gra na jaką czekałem. Chociaż jest to bardzo wczesna wersja, to już jest ogrom możliwości kreowania. Wszystko idzie jak narazie w dobrym kierunku, developer często robi updaty i patche. Jeśli tak dalej pójdzie, to będzie hit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077629511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 74610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6586, 'last_played': 1705742136}
review:
Starrachse? Oder doch Einzelradaufhängung? Querlenker oder Doppelquerlenker? Warum nicht Raumlenker? MacPherson Federbein? Warum nicht? Mach was du willst! 
Ein Motor, zwei Motoren, zehn Motoren, who cares!? Abgaswerte... Pfff
Einrad, Zweirad, Fünfrad, drehen muss es sich, wurscht wie viel!
Verdammt, Jemand hat hier sogar eine fahrbare Kloschüssel gebaut!

Also wer spass an Sandbox Games hat, wird hier nicht enttäuscht. Der Entwickler (ja, DER, nicht DIE) bleibt am Ball und bringt immer wieder was Neues.
Man hat nahezu grenzenlose Freiheit im Bau der Fahrzeuge und auf zufällig generierte Strecken kann man sein Vehikel gegen andere Geisterspieler testen.
Ich kann es weiterempfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152834376', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3237, 'last_played': 1603770467}
review:
This a great game, although I know some things that could only make it greater. Now, if you were going for a simple, realistic car building/ testing game, then you've done well.

But here is a list of 5 things that would only make the game better.

1) Water
Make the abilty for there to be randomly generated water on the default maps. This could be seen as oceans, lakes, streames, ponds, or even rivers(be even cooler if the water flowed, and moved your car). You would also want there to be the point where if you get water into your intake (more on that in a second) then your car would die. Lastly, you would want to make optional, for the people whose computers may have trouble running too much.

2) Intake
Another idea is intakes. They are quite simple. They bring in the air for the engine. One thing you could also do, is make it  so that, depending where they are placed, they can get better air flow.

3) Exaust
You could tune it, make it louder, or just cut it off. This would really just be for fun.

4) Defomable Ground
You could add some sort of vairable texture, or something, where as the ground could move out from under you. You could also add mud with the water update (if you made that a thing). It would be cool to have something where you were driving through mud, then you spun out, and gou stuck. you could also add diffrent ground textures to go with this. You could work on the sand, add gravel , mud, and other stuff too, like tall grass.

5) Winch
The last thing that I would like to include is a winch. I wouldn't care about this one as much the other things, but some other people might.

That just about wraps it up. Although lastly I would like to add that you could also add trees, and bushes, and other stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995123686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1830, 'last_played': 1615312467}
review:
Эта игра бесподобна! Вы можете играть в нее несколько дней подрят, создавая багги, забросить на неделю, а потом снова залипнуть на неделю, так как придумали новый способ усовершенствавать подвеску или раму. Dream Car Racing 3D - одна из немногих игр в которую продолжаешь играть даже не находясь за компьютером. Она заставит вас покопаться в интернете в поисках решений для релевого управления, конструкций ферм, подвески и много всего другого для того что бы заставить ваш пипелац передвигаться по бездорожью с бОльшей скоростью. 
Очень надеюсь на сетевой режим в ближайшем будущем. 
Искренне верю, что разработчиков найдет заслуженая награда, ведь это одна из немногих игр которая заставляет проявлять фантазию и интелект. 
СПАСИБО!

author: {'steamid': '76561198130634053', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1549104803}
review:
Наблюдал за проектом с его первой версии, еще на флеше, как только увидел новость на Пикабу. Игра сразу поразила богатством возможностей, даже когда еще не была в 3д. Строить транспорт здесь, наверное, даже более интересно, чем обкатывать его. 
Огромное количество настроек, примеров и инструкций - не знаю, сколько должно натикать годков, 20, 30, 50 - чтобы не получить удовольствие от игры, это конструктор для любого возраста. 
Роман, это очень высокий результат, я честно, не верил, что у тебя все получится, так держать! Только, пожалуйста, подработай оформление интерфейса.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996077235', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1556908329}
review:
Very good game, and the developer is constantly working on it (unlike, it seems, many other early-access games). It's great for anyone who's been into those bridge building games, or physics based games, or even just racing/off road car games.

Pros:
- Virtually bug free, which is fantastic for early-access.
- Excellent physics modelling; everything behaves how you should expect it to, and behaves accurately.
- Best integration with the Steam Workshop that I've seen in-game. Already a lot of user-made creations.
- Custom maps available, though the standard map has a lot of different terrain to get you going.
- Level of "OCD" is up to you; you can build a car pretty quick (or customize a default or steam Workshop car) and get racing, or spend hours tweaking every little aspect and getting things just right to shave a second or two off your laps.
- Very familiar GUI/controls to anybody who has used a CAD program before. 3-window modelling space is a great idea and works very well to let you see what you're doing.

Cons:
- Graphics could be better. Based on my framerates, this game could increase its textures and add some better shaders without being a hinderance to even mid-level PCs.
- GUI needs an update; the menus and buttons look a bit like an old Windows 95 strategy game or something.
- No controller support (YET. This is on the Dev's ToDo list, so check the details and discussions to see if it's been implemented when you read this if controller support is a must-have). Having said that, due to the nature of the off-road racing, the keyboard isn't nearly as annoying to use as a road racing game for the time being.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072959923', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1521382759}
review:
Вот уж не знаю что сказать.
Это шедевральный наследник Gmod'а в плане создания машин.
Оптимизация? Я вижу в этом мире кого-то еще волнует оптимизация. Вот бы и дальше так. ( Многие клали на оптимизацию. А тут. О БОГИ. ОНА ТУТ ЕСТЬ.  )
Радует то, что партикли не сажают FPS даже тогда, когда их много. Вот прям МНОГО.
Графен? А зачем графен он тут? И так все прекрасно. (Чем-то напоминает ExMachina)

Хотелось бы одного. Возможность закодить управление машины. ( Как Е2 там. Или CPU. Ну или на крайняк цельный Lua прикрутить X) Но отрезать опасные функции по типу os.execute() )

Все чего не хватает в сей прекрасной песочнице -
     - Что-то что является НЕ осью. И не создает осей.
     - Что-то что могло бы создать банальную ось на 1ной из не осевых точек. И не баллсокет как сейчас имеется. А именно одно осевую ось.

Ну и если тут появится некая копия ACF. То это будет 100% замена некоторым серверам в Gmod'е.

В общем. Любителям гмода и любителям строить машины - советую. ОЧЕНЬ.

P.S. Игра унаследовала болезнь подвески из гмода X)))
P.P.S. Хотелось бы получиь возможность подгружать отдельные кусочки. Заранее созданные. ( Что-то на подобии блюпринтов. )

P.P.P.S. "Одно осевая ось" © IVogel

author: {'steamid': '76561198155146718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1598044355}
review: I had the original 2d Dream Car Racing. It was a concept that I thought was perfect for those of us who like to build and test things. That has been magically transformed into 3d and now we can all truly create our dream car. I have seen realistic looking vehicles in the workshop. I have also seen fantasy and scifi looking vehicles. If You enjoy creating vehicles to drive around for nothing more than fun, this might be for You.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994174626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 64809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28664, 'last_played': 1643176772}
review:
This game, for me, has taken more hours than any other game (except perhaps Skyrim with mods) and I still enjoy it.  It is early on and plans exist to expand it and include a lot more, but I am already having a blast making everything from as realistic a vehicle as it gets to utter wacko creations (walker isn't supported yet, but I've made a few, a 'grasshopper' as well and too many wheels for my sanity one too).

Great fun if you like constructing vehicle and try out ideas and find solutions to 'why does this happen' and then realise the solution - if you experiment like me, any way.  Can also go the route I have not - make cars to race with.  I prefer exploring concepts myself.

I hope to one day see the return of an actual, functional power transmission from engine to wheel (and eventually track etc), I do miss that and am no fan of magic power transfer without connection - but that is my only 'gripe' with the game, and I still sink too many hours into it still.  ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198110800641', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1560044416}
review:
Dream Car Racing 3D ist eine gelungene Kombi aus Autobaukasten und -simulator.
Es gibt aktuell noch drei größere Wehmutstropfen:
-Fehlende Controllerunterstützung (Fahren und Lenken nur mit Tastatur möglich)
-Ausschließlich Maps für Offroadfahrten verfügbar
-Deutsche Sprache wird nicht unterstützt
Ich kann mir aber gut vorstellen, dass diese drei Nachteile irgendwann noch ausgemerzt werden.
Für Fans von Rennspielen und Fahrzeugsimulationen, die ein wenig Englisch oder Russisch können, ist dieses Spiel aber auch jetzt schon sehr empfehlenswert, unter anderem in Hinblick auf die große Menge an Fahrzeugen, die bereits im Steam Workshop verfügbar ist.
Auf meinem YouTube-Kanal findet ihr eine Playliste mit Let's Plays, falls ihr vor einem potenziellen Kauf erst noch einen detaillierteren Eindruck des Spiels bekommen wollt: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSLOx_Txo3YiMHYgwykeunu_gwwYEYjL2

author: {'steamid': '76561197996384624', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1664707122}
review:
Умная, интеллигентая, захватывающая игра-песочница!
Плюсы:
-Подробное обучение.
-Очень удобнейший редактор. В пару кликов всё понятно. Если у чего-то есть колёса, это можно воссоздать тут.
-Полная локализация (разработчик наш).
-Хороший физических движок. Реалистичная работа подвески, .
-Деформация конструкции! Напомнило Rigs of Rods, прям слезу пустил.
-Реиграбильность. Можно постить свои поделки в воркшоп, или просто качать чужие. Можно гоняться с "призраками", можно заработать деньгу и прокачать свой болид. 
-Оптимизация. Ни лагов, ни вылетов не заметил.
-Можно создавать свои карты (в Unity 3D).

Минус один - звук двигателя.
В остальном это отличная песочница, с прекрасным редактором и хорошо проработанными элементами игры. Уже сейчас в нее просто интересно играть: есть прокачка деталей, например двигатель можно улучшить = больше л.с. В будущем разработчик обещает больше деталей и карт. 

10 страданий гуманитария из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017593079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1533384075}
review:
I have been a fan of dream car racing evo for about a year, and was very excited to try out this 3D version! While building has become a LOT more complex in 3 dimensions compared to the 2D blueprint of previous games, it is certainly a lot more realistic, with the ability to truly experiment with different configurations and suspensions. A tough learning curve prevents me from fully enjoying the game so far, but I would definitely recommend it to those of you who know a bit about engineering (or would like to learn).

I hope the creator releases a few tutorials for people like me who need a little guidance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312967489', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1523504659}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198017513264', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2058, 'last_played': 1617954664}
review:
Занимательный конструктор автомобилей, в котором можно пофантазировать или попробовать сделать реальный автомобиль.
+ Режим симметрии (очень удобен, не надо дублировать каждую деталь)
+ Нет ограничений в количестве деталей (может я до него не добирался еще)
+ Можно настраивать параметры для каждой единицы конструкции.
+ Большая карта для тестирования вашего автомобиля
+ Хорошая физическая модель
+ Есть возможность включения и отключения деформации 
+ Возможность создавания трассы в режиме песочницы для соревнований с другими игроками
+ Возможность поделиться своим творением со всеми игроками как в игре, так и в воркшопе.

- Нет возможности блокировки (сварки) точек соединений рамы (по умолчанию части рамы соединяются в шарнир)
- Нет регулировки размера строительной сетки и возможности ее отображения.
- Нет списка скрытых деталей и возможности их посмотреть без отмены скрытности.
- Нет настройки параметров новой детали по умолчанию (каждую новую деталь приходится подгонять под предыдущие)
- Один вид сидения с водителем без возможности его скрыть (причем сидение не автомобильное, а больше подходит для квадрациклов или мотоциклов)
- Нет декоративных деталей интерьера и экстерьера (рули, приборы, фары)

Всего пока не учту, однако, несмотря на минусы игра вполне интересна и то, что она находится в разработке подпитывает надежды на полную реализацию проекта. Незнаю на что способен в этом плане движок Unity, но надеюсь разработчик сумеет воплотить все свои задумки, принять идеи других игроков и заставить всё это работать без багов и лагов.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991993273', 'num_games_owned': 1498, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 22957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2290, 'last_played': 1674277241}
review:
Saw this game in a video. Immediately looked it up, bought it, played. I've had it for less than a week at the time of this review, and I've sunk nearly 30 hours into it already.

TL;DR:If you like building games, this is an excellent choice.

For the marginally longer version:

The basics of the game involve constructing a wire frame out of beams with ball joints. This means making triangular structures and chaining them together to get a sturdy chassis.

Attach some wheels, an engine, some shocks and steering rods and BOOM! you have a car.

Now make it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009916106', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1549237455}
review:
I got the steam key from developers so that i can check out the game, well I must say, this game has potential, but in current state it's not that great.

Graphics are very, very basic, sound effects are almost non existing, but I do hope they improve the game.

I absolutely love the concept of this game, I like how you can freely design your car with in-game simplified model editor with almost no limits, you can put more than 1 engine, have like 100 wheels and stuff.
Game also has steam workshop which makes it really good, so people can share their creations and also edit them.

However what really made me press that YES button under "recommend" is that the game has soft body physics!
Vehicles deform just like in BeamNG.
It's too early to say anything else about the game, I didn't experience any of the usual bs that you get in other early access games, such as crashes, lag ..etc. Game runs smooth (over 200fps in 4k) and did not crash or glitch.

What i'd like to see in the game:
- better graphics + ability to add textures to your vehicles
- pre-made objects that you can attach to cars (lights, mirrors, pedals, steering wheels ..etc)
- realistic sounds (glass breaking, metal grinding, tyres screetching, tyres blowing up ..etc)
- controller support! can't drive with keyboard ... it's pain

I think with those additions, this game can really shine :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198295910231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1639845802}
review:
不知道是不是第一个入手的中国人，我是从网页版的dreamcarracing2开始玩的，有2-3年了吧，非常喜欢这类游戏，但一直遗憾没有3d版本的。期间也关注 了《围攻》、《废品机械师》等可以造车的游戏，但一直段断断续续在玩网页版dreamcarracing。一直到今年，发现作者公布了3d版的计划，当时可以说是欣喜若狂，也暂时打消了入前面两款游戏的念头。9月23号游戏公测版上线，我第一时间就入了。
      到现在已经玩了20+小时，说些小小的心得。游戏总体上手不难，基本原理和网页2d版相似，不同之处在于2d版是横版闯关类，只需控制车身姿态，而3d版难点在于如何建造包含转向功能的前轮，掌握这个后基本就可以随意发挥你的脑洞了。作为一个小品级的游戏，只有100多M的体积，流畅的动作真是让我停不下来。
      游戏目前还是前期公测状态，游戏模式比较单一。单人模式就是用有限的金币造出有完整功能的车子，而车子不能太重，否则发动机动力不足你是寸步难行的，然后进入一张大地图（其实真不是很大，车子稍微好点的话，要不了多久就能跑到地图边缘）里继续收集金币来升级车辆，这样你就可以造出想象中的车子了。沙盒模式就是随意建造升级，然后加入多人游戏。但这个多人游戏并不是实时多人在线，而是和其他玩家的记录比赛，所以互动性还是差了点。目前需要升级的部件仅有发动机和车轮，且提供的部件还很少，仅有框架、发动机、减震器、车轮、转向杆，所以能发挥的空间还是不多。不过作者已经公布了后续预计加入Angle lock, Actuator, Turbine, Pneumatic shock, Angle shock, Wing 等等部件，到那时发挥的空间就更大了。期待后期能提供更多的零件和玩法。

author: {'steamid': '76561198149316566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1509986665}
review:
I’ve played many hours of Sandbox early access building games running on the unity physics engine so naturally I was attracted to the game when I came across it on Youtube. I must admit I bought the game on impulse without knowing too much about it but I thought the price was very reasonable so I took a chance although I’ve been disappointed many times in the past.

I can now confidently say that the game has exceeded my expectations and is more than worth the price tag. If you are expecting another Besiege, Scrap Mechanic or Robocraft you are in the wrong place. The game will not hold your hand, this is not a Lego style “stick a bunch of blocks together and attach wheels” type of game. At first you will be frustrated after spending 3 hours building a car only to see it collapse under its own weight. You will go back to the drawing board, re-design the frame, re-tweak, test and repeat until finally you have a solid frame with awesome suspension and steering and you get that sense of satisfaction and accomplishment.

As far as Sandbox games go, this is proper Sandbox as you are not limited by blocks and you don’t have to stick to square angles. With only a handful of building parts you can make complex vehicles in any shape or size. 

What other content is in the game? The integration into the Steam workshop gives you endless things to play with as new maps are uploaded. Make your own racing tracks or just fool around with other people’s creations. There is Single player and multiplayer that I haven’t even tried yet (Not sure if Multiplayer is out yet). In a nutshell you won’t get bored as there is plenty to.

I was very impressed when I had questions or needed help in the Steam Community Discussions that the developer actually takes time to respond to you and assist where he can. The community also seems very helpful over all. The game is off to a great start for an early access and I haven’t found any major bugs. I am very excited to see where the developer can take this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322602498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1135, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1712425145}
review:
I was looking for long for this kind of game. And finally I found it.

This game is beta but even now is great and fun to play. You can build there any car you want with any engine you want and any suspension you want, there is only one barrier your imagination.

In game tools are easy to understand, phisics are great, and even if you want you can buld a deformable vehicle. And of course you can share your design in Steam Workshop or build in game Workshop, easy as can be.

There is only one map but hey this game is avaliable for few days and we have 3 addon maps. I am looking forward for more addon maps.

Great appreciation to developer!

Would buy again!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989576301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1476012012}
review:
[b]Wersja skrócona: [/b]
Samochodowe Kerbal Space Program, choć na razie bez wyraźnego celu. Ale wg. mnie warto.

[b]Wersja dłuższa:[/b]
Bardzo interesujące podejście do gry o tworzeniu samochodów. Do dyspozycji dostajemy belki, amortyzatory, silnik, koła, belki wspomagający, wały transmisyjne czy chociażby drążki kierowniczy i musimy z tego wszystkiego skonstruować działający pojazd. Co zresztą nie jest takie proste i potrzeba wielu prób i błędów, aby dojść do względnie działajacej konstrukcji. A następnie ulepszamy konstrukcję lepszymi częściami, które wykupujemy poprzez złoto otrzymane za wygrane wyścigi, bądź też złoto znalezione porozrzucane losowo na mapie.

Gra jest aktualnie w baaardzo wczesnej fazie produkcji, ale już teraz można w niej zauważyć to 'coś', co odróżnia ją od pozostałych podobnych gier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035669409', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 140, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1711931968}
review:
Very fun game! More complicated than the original 2D flash games, but after a couple minutes, it's not too hard to figure out. Highly recommended if you're a fan of sandbox games, racing games, or cars/mechanics.
EDIT:
Recent updates have added lift for panels and jet engines. I can't stop playing, making airplanes, flying go-carts, etc. This update made the game at least twice as fun, and for anyone who has learned how to design planes from games such as Kerbal Space Program or Simple Planes, I would challenge you to try in this game. It's more difficult (you have to manually design the control surfaces) but about 10x more rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170945422', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 10009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5196, 'last_played': 1673768483}
review:
1) Yes I've noticed bugs but I've already reported them to you and the ones I have seen have been fixed already
2) Most things are clear in the game but I would recommend adding video support in-game so you can post tutorials on how to make something like a working suspension, instead of prebuilt saves you can load.
3) I love this game and have not gotten bored of it mostly because I am usually in sandbox, although I still enjoy single player.
4) I like single player but I think it needs work and some refinement, for example you need to add some racing maps in, add tracks, and when you can publish the best map or track someone has made into single player.
5) My opinion about sandbox is that it is amazing and that I love how you can post tracks in-game for other people to try out and it's fun to be able to build what ever you want and just mess around and enjoy it.
6) My opinion of the game is 4 out of 5 stars because of how great of a game this is and how you can build what ever you want and their is almost no limit to what you can build. The reason I didn't give this game a higher rating is because it still needs work and it still has those few ideas and details that would make this game ever better, I enjoyed this game and can't wait to see what becomes of it in the future

This game has been fixed 5 out of 5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009079648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1653949661}
review:
Эта одна из немногоих игр, которую я не могу упрекнуть за минимум контента.По факту из готовых блоков здесь только колеса,и "персонаж".Остальное собирается рамой или если угодно скелетом,здесь отлично отрабатываются силовые корпуса,различные типы подвесок и пр.Плюсом так же можно вполне считать евенты типа гонок, или собирание монет во фриране.
 В общем практически максимум свободы для моделирования  техники + для линивых интегрирован workshop.

Ну и в заключение могу сказать что вполне достойный наследник одноименной браузерки.

review: You are able to make all kind of vehicles, bikes, tanks, quad-bikes and all that stuff, from wheel to an engine customization mechanics, really good physics for vehicles, there can be made custom maps as well loops, ramps, and multiplayer coming soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094617136', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 21966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10453, 'last_played': 1528917775}
review:
Any bugs?:

I have noticed a plethora of bugs, all of which were resolved within 24 hours (Except a recent one which the developer is working on/has fixed in this last update)

How were the directions:

 Well, I practically re-wrote the directions/help (And had fun doing so, I love writing and tweaking my work and developing my communications skills) so if anything is confusing it is on me. Obviously I confidently support my work as good, but still, I am human. Error is inevitable.

How much did I earn in single player before you got tired: 

I do not know, still not tired of this game. I've loged 170 hours by the time of this post

Singleplayer: 

Needs tweaking, but is very good as it stands.


Multiplayer:

 I like it, but I feel it should be tied in some way to single player in some way to motivate/force the player to gain experience in single player force. You do not want someone to see incredible records, try in vain to beat them, then rage quit and leave a bad review. (Very much my opinion)


My position as a beta tester:

For one to think that I am merely just another beta tester would simply be uninformed. I have distinctly left my mark on this game. That being said, I am just that, a beta tester. A beta tester lucky enough to get included in a project where he could make a difference. I have beta tested many games, but never have I enjoyed it as much as I have enjoyed beta testing this game. I do not understand why he chose my email over anyone else's, but in the end (Speaking from that it is two days before release) I took the opportunity and ran with it.


My opinion on the development of DCR 3D:

I feel this game has the potential to be the next big thing. Roman (RoKo0) is an absolute genius (Coming from someone with a 140 IQ, I'm no genius, but I can recognize one), I can distinctly see where he made decisions in developing his IP (Intellectual property) that many would have mistakenly overlooked. For example, his decision to make 2D variations of his IP before making a 3D one. Doing this bagged him a following before he even started work on the 3D version. He stuck to his guns through the beta testing period, where I frequently pushed him to make the game more realistic. In the end, I feel he found the perfect balance between realism and the softer cartoon-ish side of the game that makes it so charming (Something that I milked with my recent map and car designs).


How I started playing DCR:

I first saw DCR on Flonga many years ago. I tried everything I knew to crack the game. Even downloading the flash version of the game and running it in an isolated environment and searching for changing variables with cheat engine (I.E, I would search all variables with cheat engine, then earn money search for changed variables, not earn money, search for unchanged variables etc...). The simple fact that I could not crack his game, hooked me and I soon bought the first iteration of his game (Admittedly, if it was more expensive, I would have tried harder and eventually at least hacked credits).


My opinion of DCR 3D:

Right now it is really fun (10/10, I mean it has kept me till the 240th Beta Test post, which is my 88th, and 170 in-game hours so far), but looking at his plans for the future, it is going to be so much better. I look forward to watching this game spread its wings, but I am not convinced that this game is completely ready to leave its chrysalis. That being said, I recognize that the game needs to be released sometime and that there is no better time than when you have everything working perfectly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000662213', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1510616660}
review: (Reviewing experience of the pre-release beta) I recorded a first look/highlights video of this for my channel a few days before release and it made for some fun and entertaining footage!  This is a game with serious potential in building capabilities.  It is very complex, looking at all the options going into it, but the complexity is clearly a testament to the amount of creative freedom the game allows you to have.  There is a ton of room for improvement of course, but It looks like those improvements are being worked on regularly.  I hope the development of this game continues into what I know it can be!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1486263014}
review:
[h1]A Car Building Sandbox Racing Game[/h1]
https://youtu.be/OhLvcG6eeCM
+ The car editor is very easy to understand and use without any instruction.
+ Lots of options to modify, for example: Wheel size, pressure, suspension, torque, transmission, etc., building a reliable car is actually pretty challenging.
+ You can test out other user's creations, and modify them however you like which is a ton of fun!
+ The map itself is HUGE giving you plenty of space
+ Very easy to publish your car to the server / steam workshop without any hassle. It's also very simple to load up other creations, and takes no time at all.

[b]This game is in Early Access so these are subject to change[/b]
- The engine sounds for every car need to be improved.
- No background music
- The physics are a bit odd. Every car is overly bouncy and need a bit more weight
- The map itself is just a series of hills and mountains. Good for off-roading, but I feel like it would be great if the developer could add some flatlands or actual road racetracks.
- The "races" are a bit unfair as the AI little cars don't have to deal with physics
